thread.title: Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7
thread.title_full: Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7

title: Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7
text:
Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7 Pierz piles up 402 yards offensively to improve to 8-0 with win over Holdingford Post to Facebook Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7 Pierz piles up 402 yards offensively to improve to 8-0 with win over Holdingford Check out this story on sctimes.com: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/09/prep-football-pioneers-cruise-past-huskers/73707870/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Prep football: No. 1 Pioneers cruise past Huskers, 49-7 Tom Elliott , telliott@stcloudtimes.com 10:38 p.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Buy Photo Pierz's Ted Dehler (73) sacks Holdingford quarterback Alex Knapp (8) as Holdingford's Brandon Skroch (23) looks on in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. (Photo: Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com) Buy Photo 
HOLDINGFORD — Lane Girtz was grinning when he said it. 
“Well,” the Pierz junior running back said. “We got that first goal out of the way.” 
Pierz beat Holdingford 49-7 Friday to finish the season 8-0 before a large Parents’ Night Crowd and against one of its best rivals. 
“That” was the Mid State Sub-Division I championship along with the top seed in the Section 5-3A playoffs. 
The Pioneers did “that” impressively, churning for 402 yards on 50 plays, including 344 yards on the ground. 
And they did “that” against a team that is the defending state Class 2A champion and honoring a senior class that has been to three straight state tournaments and posted a 36-10 record in Holdingford. 
Story continues below. Buy Photo Holdingford's Griffin Olson (15) tries to make his way around a trio of Pierz defenders in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz's Ted Dehler (73) sacks Holdingford quarterback Alex Knapp (8) as Holdingford's Brandon Skroch (23) looks on in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz's Michael Meyer (40) intercepts a pass intended for Holdingford's Brandon Skroch (23) in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz quarterback Aaron Weber looks for a receiver against Holdingford in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Holdingford cheerleaders try to bring the spirits up for the home team's fans. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Holdingford running back Griffin Olson (15) looks for a way around Pierz's Kolton Eschews (20) in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Pierz quarterback Aaron Weber hands off the ball to running back Lane Girtz (46) against Holdingford in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Holdingford defensive coordinator Cody VanSloten talks to his players in the first half Friday against Pierz. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloud Fullscreen Buy Photo Holdingford fans try to get the attention of the cheerleaders to get a free t-shirt in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Holdingford quarterback Alex Knapp (8) passes the ball to tight end Brandon Skroch (23) under pressure from Pierz linebacker Brett Kapsner (52) in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. Skroch carried the ball into the end zone for a Holdingford touchdown with 6:41 left in the second quarter. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo Holding ford tight end Brandon Skroch (23) gets past Pierz defender Noah Boser (24) and turns toward the end zone for a Holdingford touchdown with 6:41 left in the first half. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Fullscreen Buy Photo A referee signals a Pierz touchdown in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. By the end of the first half, Pierz led 35-7. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Holdingford Fans watch the game against Pierz under the stadium lights Friday night. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Pierz's Lane Girtz (46) kicks off in the second quarter Friday in Holdingford. Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay 
“It was a pretty good night,” said enormous Pierz two-way tackle David Skiba. “It’s been a pretty good rivalry for a long time. 
“We came at it pretty good with the guys giving their full effort and really coming together.” 
It’s been a very impressive 8-0 run. 
“They’re the real deal,” Holdingford head coach Luke Mitchell said. “They’re very, very good.” 
The Pioneers haven’t allowed a first-quarter point all season, outscoring their opponents 73-0. They’ve rushed for almost 2,400 yards in eight games, but had no one with more than 400 yards going into Friday’s game. 
Girtz had the big night Friday. He had 10 rushes for 130 yards and three touchdowns. Jonny Kasper, the Pioneers’ leading rusher, had 10 carries for 80 yards and a touchdown. They had eight players carry the ball Friday. 
The players said they were well-prepared. 
“That says a lot about our coaching,” said Skiba, who is listed at 6-foot-3 and 295 pounds. “They put so much more time into it than I do.” 
“Yeah, while they’re golfing,” Girtz quipped about the Pierz coaches. 
Pioneers head coach Leo Pohlkamp and offensive coordinator Rick Sczublewski are indeed retired and do like to golf. 
But they and the rest of the staff have put together an impressive team. While they run the ball extremely well, they’ve passed for nine touchdowns this season with no interceptions. 
Aaron Weber found Michael Meyer in the end zone for a 21-yard touchdown pass in the second quarter that put Pierz up 28-7. 
And they play defense. Holdingford, which perennially has one of the area’s top ground games, was held to 102 yards, including 74 rushing on 33 attempts. 
Story continues below. Buy Photo 
Holdingford running back Griffin Olson (15) looks for a way around Pierz's Kolton Eischens (20) in the first half Friday night in Holdingford. (Photo: Kimm Anderson, kanderson@stcloudtimes.com) 
“We’ve stayed pretty healthy all season,” said Pohlkamp, who is in his 30th year as head coach. “In eight games, we’ve had no real serious injuries.” 
Meyer had his seventh interception. Huskers quarterback Alex Knapp, who found Brandon Skroch for a 14-yard TD, was sacked four times. 
“The coaches tell us the first eight games are practice,” Skiba said. 
“We’re 0-0,” Girtz said. 
Pierz is going to get the top seed in the Section 5-3A playoffs which begin Wednesday. The Pioneers will have a first-round bye. Holdingford awaits word on its seed in Section 6-3A. Those playoffs begin Tuesday. 
There were too many variables Friday night for Mitchell to be sure who Holdingford was going to play. The Huskers expect to be on the road. 
“We’ve got a long way to go,” Mitchell said. “We don’t want to be choosing who we want to play right now.” 
The pairings for both sections will be finalized Saturday.

P — Jonny Kasper 14 run (Lane Girtz kick) 
P — L. Girtz 65 run (Preston Rocheleau kick)

Individual statistics 
Rushing: P — L. Girtz 10-130, Kasper 10-80, Derick Hall 5-56, Schlegel 7-32, Noah Boser 8-20, Jalen Jansen 2-14, Ben Herold 2-10, N. Girtz 2-2. Total: 46-344. H — Griffin Olson 3-30, Nolan Prokott 11-28, Jacob Langerud 3-20, Devin Motschke 3-8, Aaron Maleska 1-5, Wyatt Johnson 2-5, Skroch 2-0, Knapp 6-(-22). Total: 33-74. 
Passing: P — Weber 3-4-0 58. H — Knapp 2-8-1 25. 
Receiving: P — Meyer 2-35, Kolton Eischens 1-23. H —Skroch 2-28.
